@graph.rdfs:label: Parameter Identification of Time-Dependent Immune Response Coefficient E(t) in HIV Dynamical Model via Tikhonov Regularization and Adaptive Finite Elements

@graph.schema:name: Clinical HIV patient data (4 patients)
@graph.schema:description: Time-series measurements of total T-cells (uninfected + infected) and virus load from Tables 2–3, interpolated to daily points

@graph.rdfs:label: Linear interpolation of sparse clinical measurements to daily time grid [0,363]

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Daily interpolated g1(t) and g2(t) for 4 patients

@graph.rdfs:label: Derivation of Lagrangian, adjoint system, Fréchet derivative, and a posteriori error estimates for Tikhonov functional

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Equations (4.9)–(6.67): Optimality system, adjoint problem, gradient expression, error estimators

@graph.rdfs:label: Finite-element (P0) + implicit Euler discretization of forward/adjoint problems + Newton solver
Implementation of Adaptive Conjugate Gradient Algorithm (ACGA) with residual-based mesh refinement

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Reconstructed immune response E_k(t) on adaptively refined meshes for 4 patients
Forward solutions u1+u2, u3 matching clinical data after optimization
Figures 3–25: Reconstructions, virus dynamics, residuals, convergence plots

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Patient-specific E0(t) with CTL burst parameters
